comment.author: 51035743246@N01
comment._content: I found articles about this cyclist (also spelled, "Jackie Clarke", and "Jackey Clarke") in the New York Times archive from July 26, 1914, April 26, 1915 and August 9, 1909 about races at the Brighton Beach Motordrome and the Newark Velodrome. Jackie was known as The Australian Rocket.

comment.author: 64942209@N00
comment._content: @ A.E. :-) Hi, I'm an admin for a group called The Bicycle, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 41401994@N04
comment._content: His full name was John Adolphus Clark (Jr.), birthdate 1 March 1888 at Camperdown, Victoria, Australia, and he immigrated to the U.S. in April 1906 (per his 1920 passport application on Ancestry.com). In 1920 he was going to visit his parents in Australia, and his occupation was listed as "professional cyclist and hotel proprietor". John Adolphus Clark married Rena A. Bray on 31 Aug 1910 in Salt Lake City, UT but they were apparently divorced. Marriage license: udn.lib.utah.edu/cgi-bin/showfile.exe?CISOROOT=/tgm2&... Marriage record: abish.byui.edu/specialCollections/westernStates/westernSt... Don't know if he later had another marriage. Article at udn.lib.utah.edu/cgi-bin/showfile.exe?CISOROOT=/tgm2&...: Salt Lake Telegram (newspaper), 14 Mar 1915: NEWARK, March 13.--- "Jackie Clark, the Australian cyclist, will now have U.S.A. entered after his name on all programs. The little fellow from the land of the kangaroo was granted his naturalization papers last week in Newark. Clark's application was heard by Judge Martin in the common pleas court in the New Jersey city, and the judge at first denied the application when there was a slipup on the part of the cyclist in regards to the latter having lived in Salt Lake City during the season of 1911. After Jackie, who had pleaded to be a United States citizen under the name of JOHN ADOLPHUS CLARK, proved by contracts and letters bearing on that season the judge promptly accepted the documents as good proof and granted the papers." "Adolphus John Clark", birthdate 1 Mar 1888 in a foreign country, died 22 Dec 1958 in Santa Barbara County, California (per California Death Index on Ancestry.com)

comment.author: 74511444@N04
comment._content:
Hi,
 My name is Clive Allen-Paisley from Geelong in Victoria Australia.
Jackie is a relative of mine that I have been researching for quite a while now and would be interested in any information that anyone may have about Jackie and I am also only to happy to share what I have collected so far.
